Sentencas: We present a steady-state thermodynamic model of a hybrid solid oxide fuel cell (SOFC)-gas turbine (GT) cycle developed using a commercial process simulation software, AspenPlus (TM).
Titulo: Effects of operating and design parameters on the performance of a solid oxide fuel cell-gas turbine system

Sentencas: The hybrid cycle model incorporates a zero-dimensional macro-level SOFC model.
Titulo: Effects of operating and design parameters on the performance of a solid oxide fuel cell-gas turbine system

Sentencas: A parametric study was carried out using the developed model to study the effects of system pressure, SOFC operating temperature, turbine inlet temperature, steam-to-carbon ratio, SOFC fuel utilization factor, and GT isentropic efficiency on the specific work output and efficiency of a generic hybrid cycle with and without anode recirculation.
Titulo: Effects of operating and design parameters on the performance of a solid oxide fuel cell-gas turbine system

Sentencas: The results show that system pressure and SOFC operating temperature increase the cycle efficiency regardless of the presence of anode recirculation.
Titulo: Effects of operating and design parameters on the performance of a solid oxide fuel cell-gas turbine system

Sentencas: On the other hand, the specific work decreases with operating temperature.
Titulo: Effects of operating and design parameters on the performance of a solid oxide fuel cell-gas turbine system

Sentencas: Overall, the model can successfully capture the complex performance trends observed in hybrid cycles.
Titulo: Effects of operating and design parameters on the performance of a solid oxide fuel cell-gas turbine system
Effects of operating and design parameters on the performance of a solid oxide fuel cell-gas turbine system
